#Text=Wikinews Shorts : August 11 , 2009
#Text=A compilation of brief news reports for
#Text=Tuesday , August 11 , 2009
#Text=.
#Text=Bomb campaign in Iraq kills almost 50
#Text=A series of bombs exploded early on Monday morning has killed at least 49 and wounded 260 more in Iraq .
#Text=At 4:30AM local time ( 01:30 GMT ) , two truck bombs exploded in Khaznah , a village near Mosul , the capital of the Ninawa Governorate .
#Text=The village is Shia dominated in a predominantly Sunni area .
#Text=These bombs killed at least 28 , wounded 130 , and were so powerful that 30 houses were destroyed .
#Text=Later a sequence of bombs exploded in the capital Baghdad targeting , amongst others , construction workers and labourers gathering to find work .
#Text=The current attacks are the most serious since American troops withdrew from Iraqi cities in late June and a lull in violence in July .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Jamal Hashim .
#Text=" Spate of bombings in Iraq kill 49 , fomenting fear for sectarian strife " — Xinhua News Agency , August 11 , 2009
#Text=" Bomb attacks in Iraq kill dozens " — BBC News Online , August 10 , 2009
#Text=Richard Spencer .
#Text=" Iraq bombs wrack cities and raise doubts on army " — The Telegraph , August 10 , 2009
#Text=Missing pop star Noriko Sakai arrested
#Text=Japanese pop star Noriko Sakai was arrested on Saturday when she turned herself in after being missing since Monday .
#Text=Sakai was reported missing by her mother in law after the arrest of her husband for the possession of illegal stimulants .
#Text=Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department
#Text=investigators are reported to believe that Sakai did not plan her disappearance , but panicked over the media coverage that followed the authorities request for her to report to the police .
#Text=It had been feared that Sakai , who rose to fame as a teenage singer and actress , had harmed herself .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Media frenzy scared Sakai from giving up " — The Japan Times , August 11 , 2009
#Text=" Pop star Sakai arrested in Tokyo " — BBC News Online , August 9 , 2009
#Text=Baby P killers to be named and then allowed to disappear
#Text=Following the expiry of an anonymity order the identity of the killers of Baby P can now be named by the British mainstream media .
#Text=Following the notoriety of the case in which Baby P was seen to have been failed by the authorities , a judge ordered that none of the three be named to protect Baby P 's four siblings .
#Text=However a weakness of the anonymity order was that the identities of the three could be found by anyone who searched for it online .

#Text=The nature of Baby P 's death has led to fears for the safety of the three , and it is likely that they will be given new identities once they have served their sentences and then be allowed to disappear from the public gaze .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Adam Fresco and Rosemary Bennett .
#Text=" Baby P 's self-obsessed mother , her sadistic lover and lodger are named " — The Times , August 11 , 2009
#Text=" Couple behind Baby P death named " — BBC News Online , August 10 , 2009
#Text=Royal Opera House to stage opera comprising of tweets
#Text=The Royal Opera House in London will stage a new opera to be written by the public .
#Text=Set to a score of familiar and popular tunes by composers such as Verdi will be a new libretto comprising entirely of tweets from the micro blogging site Twitter .
#Text=Act One , Scene One of the opera has been completed , written 140 characters at a time .
#Text=In the story so far a man called William is imprisoned in a tower by birds , his only companion a talking cat .
#Text=The Royal Opera House is conducting the musical experiment to widen public understanding and access to opera and hopes to perform extracts from the work early in September .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" London opera house struggles to make tweet music " — Agence France-Presse , August 10 , 2009
#Text=Sasjkia Otto .
#Text=" ' The Twitter Opera ' : new Royal Opera House production in ' tweets ' " — The Telegraph , August 10 , 2009

column1: #Text=Taliban gunmen launch attack in Afghanistan
#Text=Taliban
#Text=militants have launched an audacious gun and rocket attack in Pul-i-Alam some 45 miles from Kabul , Afghanistan .

#Text=Six Taliban gunmen , described as wearing explosive vests , managed to gain access to an unfinished tower block in the provincial capital of Logar Province which overlooked several government buildings and compounds , including that of the local chief of police and governor 's residence .
#Text=From their vantage point the gunmen fired rocket propelled grenades killing at least five and wounding twenty six police officers .

#Text=The gunmen continued to engage security forces with small arms fire for several hours , with witnesses to the events claiming that attack helicopters were called in to bring the militants under fire .
#Text=The authorities claim that at least four of the gunmen were killed at least two by return fire and one who blew himself up .
#Text=The attack comes ten days before presidential elections due to be held on the 20th of August .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Steve Herman .
#Text=" Taliban Attack Government Buildings South of Kabul " — Voice of America , August 10 , 2009

#Text=Paul Tait .
#Text=" Security developments in Afghanistan , Aug 10 " — Reuters , August 10 , 2009
#Text=Climate conference opens in Bonn
#Text=About a 1000 delegates from 180 countries are meeting in Bonn , Germany for a third round of climate talks .
#Text=The talks are to negotiate the text of a protocol to succeed Kyoto which will be presented to the Copenhagen Conference later this year .

#Text=Speaking at an other conference in Seoul , South Korea UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said " If we fail to act , climate change will intensify droughts , floods and other natural disasters ...
